newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore "not concerned" by weak Sing $ vs US$.
newsitem.headline: Singapore "not concerned" by weak Sing $ vs US$.

text.p: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) said on Tuesday it was not concerned over the recent weakness of the Singapore dollar against the U.S. dollar.
MAS official Koh Beng Seng told a news conference:
"Since the minister of finance (Richard Hu) was not concerned by the movement of the Singapore dollar against the U.S. dollar, neither is the MAS."
The Singapore dollar has slipped to around 1.42, from closer to 1.40 a month ago, under pressure from the strength of the U.S. currency.
